Articles.Content:
Insert the ":" in the middle of the four digit number after "gmt".

Any bets this problem increases when 0.24 drops and traffic peaks?

Oh, I'll be on for 5 minutes a day. 2 minutes typing. 3 minutes waiting for the errors to go away.... Which they won't. This website will EXPLODE when they come flooding back in...

Uhhh... What's the times in those? Arnt there supposed to be : s in there?

All times are in military standard time 2220 = 22:20 = 10:20pm = 20 past 10 at night

All times are in military standard time 2220 = 22:20 = 10:20pm = 20 past 10 at night

Please. It's 1:08am. I'm too tired to convert those... Use 12h time. Please.

Military time is quite simple:


if (hours < 12) {
    doNothing();
}
else {
    hours = hours - 12;
    timeOfDaySuffix = "PM";
}

... I've been programming too much recently.

I must say I`m not suffering these errors like others are. (I`ve had one in the past week)

Maybe it`s location influenced. I`m in the UK for example.

Where are you? (talking to the people affected most)

I must say I`m not suffering these errors like others are. (I`ve had one in the past week)

Wait, the threads got merged? I AM NOW RESPONSIBLE FOR STARTING THE ERROR OCCURRENCE LIST MWAHAHAHAHAHA

Wait, the threads got merged? I AM NOW RESPONSIBLE FOR STARTING THE ERROR OCCURRENCE LIST MWAHAHAHAHAHA

I know your jking, but the thread name remains under my control. There's just two main posts... I will continue to list them...

Sooo your telling me it not the popularity of my new zoid crashing the servers....

Way to add to their server troubles.
I, too have been having lots of 502 errors recently.

Getting a lot of these right now. ~17:25 GMT.

(Think you messed up your time zone conversion Spartwo.)

I live in Greenwiches time zone, there is no conversion.

Did you forget about the semi-annual hour change?(around the Solstices)

Edited July 15, 2014 by Spartwo

I live in Greenwiches time zone, there is no conversion.

Did you forget about the semi-annual hour change?

GMT doesn't change. You're in BST, I presume.
For the third time I LIVE IN GMT!
It's happened to me too, more often than it should. At least twice an hour.

For the third time I LIVE IN GMT!

I get that. But when the clocks change by an hour for summer it stops being GMT and becomes BST for the UK (not sure what it's called elsewhere).

Similarly, my timezone is usually NST, but is NDT in the summer (which actually makes my location at left a bit inaccurate this time of year).
I had one on the way to report one just now.
It's getting alot worse. had 3 in like, 20 minutes.
